Modifiers

The following table provides information on the members of the concurrent_set and concurrent_multiset template classes.
Member Description
std::pair<iterator, bool> insert(const value_type& x)

Constructs a copy of x and attempts to insert it into the set. If the attempt fails because an equivalent item already exists, this copy is destroyed.

Returns: std::pair(iterator, success). The value of iterator points to an item in the set equivalent to x. The value of success is true if the item was inserted, false otherwise.

std::pair<iterator, bool> insert(value_type&& x)

Moves x into the new instance of value_type and attempts to insert it into the set. If the attempt fails because an equivalent item already exists, this item is destroyed.

x is left in a valid, but unspecified state.

Returns: std::pair(iterator, success). The value of iterator points to an item in the set equivalent to x. The value of success is true if the item was inserted, false otherwise.

iterator insert(const_iterator hint, const value_type& x)

The same as insert(const value_type& x).

Returns: insert(x).first.

iterator insert(const_iterator hint, value_type&& x)

The same as insert(value_type&& x).

Returns: insert(x).first.

template<typename InputIterator>

void insert(InputIterator first, InputIterator last)

Inserts elements from half-open interval [first, last) into the set.

void insert(std::initializer_list<value_type> il)

The same as insert(il.begin(), il.end()).

std::pair<iterator, bool> insert(node_type&& nh).

Attempts to insert the node owned by nh into the set. If the attempt fails because an equvalent item already exists, ownership of the node remains at nh. Otherwise nh is left in an empty state.

Returns: std::pair(iterator, success). The value of iterator points to an item in the set equivalent to nh.value(). The value of success is true if the item was inserted, false otherwise.

iterator insert(const_iterator hint, node_type&& nh)

The same as insert(node_type&& nh).

Returns: insert(nh).first.

template<typename... Args>

std::pair<iterator, bool> emplace(Args&&... args)

Constructs an instance of value_type from args and attempts to insert it into the set. If the attempt fails because an equivalent item already exists, this instance is destroyed.

Returns: std::pair(iterator, success). The value of iterator points to an item in the set equivalent to constructed value_type object. The value of success is true if the item was inserted, false otherwise.

template<typename... Args>

iterator emplace_hint(const_iterator hint, Args&& args)

The same as emplace(args...).

Returns: emplace(args...).first.

template<typename SrcCompare>

void merge(concurrent_set<key_type, SrcCompare, allocator_type>& source)

template<typename SrcCompare>

void merge(concurrent_set<key_type, SrcCompare, allocator_type>&& source)

template<typename SrcCompare>

void merge(concurrent_multiset<key_type, SrcCompare, allocator_type>& source)

template<typename SrcCompare>

void merge(concurrent_multiset<key_type, SrcCompare, allocator_type>&& source)

Transfers those items from source which keys do not exists in *this.

CAUTION

The merge operation is concurrency-safe for the target set (i.e. the instance for which the method is called), but not for the source set. The behaviour is underfined if source is concurrently modified or merged into more than one target set.
iterator unsafe_erase(const_iterator position)

Removes the item pointed by position from the set.

Returns: iterator pointing on the item that was immediately after the erased item, or end() if erased item was the last item in the set.

iterator unsafe_erase(iterator position)

Removes the item pointed by position from the set.

Returns: iterator pointing on the item that was immediately after the erased item, or end() if erased item was the last item in the set.

iterator unsafe_erase(const_iterator first, const_iterator last)

Removes all the elements in half-open interval [first, last).

Returns: iterator, following the last removed element.

size_type unsafe_erase(const key_type& k)

Removes all items, equivalent to k.

Returns: the number of the removed items.

template<typename K>

size_type unsafe_erase(const K& k)

Removes all items with the key, that compares equivalent to the value k.

Only participates in overload resolution if key_compare::is_transparent is valid and denotes a type and the type K is not convertible to neither iterator and const_iterator.

Returns: the number of the removed items.

node_type unsafe_extract(const_iterator position)

Transfers ownership of the node with the item pointed by position from the set to a node handle.

Returns: the node handle that owns the extracted node.

node_type unsafe_extract(const key_type& k)

If an item equivalent to k exists in the set, transfers ownership of the corresponding node to the node handle.

Returns: the node handle that owns the extracted node, or an empty node handle if a matching item was not found.

void clear()

Removes all items from the set.

The following table provides additional information on the concurrent_set template class.
Member Description
void swap(concurrent_set& other)

Swaps contents of *this and other.

The following table provides additional information on the concurrent_multiset template class.
Member Description
void swap(concurrent_multiset& other)

Swaps contents of *this and other.

Parent topic: concurrent_set and concurrent_multiset Template Classes
